channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was leaking during unload of a trailer. Package was given to a belt manager and the manager placed the hazmat in our cage under the hood. Package had internal leakage due to no inner packaging which caused the caps to become loose during transit.

item.title: Report E-2024070209
item.description:
Report E-2024070209

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: QUINTON
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6575
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank when the hose ruptured. This allowed approximately 20 gallons of gasoline to be released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2024070549
item.description:
Report X-2024070549

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-05
  • City: LORTON
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A box containing 4 gallons was found in the area, and it was determined to be wet. Following a swift assessment confirming the presence of hazardous materials, the box was promptly relocated to the designated hazardous materials storage area. Upon thorough examination, it was revealed that one of the bottles had a loose cap, resulting in spillage that contaminated and compromised the integrity of the other bottles.
